title: Will tech companies such as Google or Facebook ever have legitimate competition or have they essentially become monopolies? - Quora

response.answer_text: The two parts of this question are quite unrelated. Being a monopoly does not preclude you from having legitimate competition in the future. If you have no legitimate competition at the moment, then you are a monopoly. I believe that Google and maybe Facebook are monopolies at the moment, in that they have no legitimate competition at the moment in their primary fields. That being said, I think it’s very likely that in the future they will have legitimate competition. It would be naive to think otherwise. Google and Facebook need to keep innovating and getting better in order to keep others playing catch-up and maintain their market dominance. I’m a pretty big fan of Google and their products, but the moment there is a better search engine, I will switch to it. I use Google because it’s the best.
The tech companies have competition now
